name: 社會與情緒發展研究
description: This course will examine the theoretical and empirical literature on social and emotional development from childhood through adolescence and young adulthood. The course will help students to think about how developmental processes interweave with social environment to influence a person’s sense of self, identity, relationships, interpersonal interactions, and emotional experiences.
goals: To acquire fundamental knowledge in domain of Social and Emotional Development
To develop related skills to conduct research in Social and Emotional Development
To appreciate and respect the diverse theoretical perspectives in Social and Emotional Development
syllabus:
Theoretical and methodological considerations

The content of development: Emotional regulation, temperament, attachment, self, aggression, social cognition

The context of development: Parents and the family, peers
